sorcer.core.context

Class ContextLink

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.core.context.ContextLink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Link

    public class ContextLink
extends Object
implements Link
    Provides for service context linking. Context links are references to an offset (path) in a context, which allows the reuse of context objects.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Add a context link given the context id and offset.

        public ContextLink(Uuid id,
           float version,
           String offset,
           SorcerPrincipal principal)
            throws ContextException
        Add a context link given the context id and offset. Note the context must have already been persisted in database.
        Throws:
        ContextException

      • ContextLink

        public ContextLink(Context context,
           String offset)
            throws ContextException
        Add a context link given the context and offset. Public access to this method is probably temporary, as the preferred constructor is #contextLink(String, SorcerPrincipal, String), since that method requires the context has already been persisted.
        Throws:
        ContextException

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(String offset)
               throws ContextException
        Sets the offset in this linked context. If the offset itself is obtained by traversing a link (meaning there is a redundant link), the offset is recalculated and the link object is reset to point to the owning context (removing the redundancy).

        Note: when links are originally set in ServiceContext, checks are performed.

        Specified by:
        setOffset in interface Link
        Throws:
        ContextException
